Key Match Events: Karl Anthony Towns set the tone for the game by making the first two baskets for New York, both of which were three-pointers.
Six players scored in double figures for the Knicks.
The Knicks held Milwaukee’s dynamic duo to a combined 43 points and limited them to 0-for-5 from beyond the arc.
The Knicks scored 21 fast break points, marking their second-highest total this season.
OG Anunoby showcased some of the best perimeter defense in the league by consistently putting a former MVP out of his comfort zone and switching onto Damian Lillard.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks have returned to a .500 record and have no days off ahead, with their next six games against teams with records below .500.
Winning all six games decisively could ignite a momentum that lasts throughout the season.
Towns playing like an All-NBA talent while Anunoby locks down an opposing team’s best player is one of the variations of attack New York presents with this roster when healthy.
